results.title: Here's to your health: health for youth
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit, Craig Reardon and Robert Grant
results.brief_description: A program to rise the knowledge of health issues concerning young people. It aims to promote the awareness of “Health for youth” projects and illustrates what’s happening around the state with health-related issues.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit, Craig Reardon and Robert Grant

results.title: Here's the Sex Pistols
results.creator_credit: Sex Pistols Residuals and Sex Pistols
results.brief_description: Live performance by the British rock punk group, the Sex Pistols, at the Longhorn Ballroom, Dallas on 10 January 1978. Also includes two bonus clips of “Anarchy in the UK” and “God save the Queen”. Members of the band: Johnny Rotten, Sid Vicious, Steve Jones and Paul Cook.

results.title: Here's sport
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit and Ray Dicks
results.brief_description: Pokes gentle fun at the British pre-occupation with sport, but provides at the same time a lively and comprehensive review of British sporting life, ranging from the big popular games - such as cricket and football - to indoor marbles and a race for traction engines.

results.title: Here's looking at you, Warner Bros.
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Wolper Organisation and Robert Guenette
results.brief_description: This feature length documentary celebrates 90 years of moviemaking history at Warner Bros in Hollywood. An entertaining chronicle of the studio’s history unfolds using choice moments from classic Warner films, interviews with artists and technicians, early screentests by Lana Turner, Orson Welles, Marlon Brando and Paul Newman, bloopers by Ronald Reagan and James Cagney and historical behind-the-scenes footage. Narrated by Clint Eastwood, Barbra Streisand, Goldie Hawn, Steven Spielberg and Chevy Chase.

results.title: Here's looking at you kids
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Hubar Ghazarian and Michael Metzner
results.brief_description: This lively and inventive student short looks at how the lives of a group of workers and regular visitors of a busy laundromat change when a television enters their environment. TV drama starts to breed into everyday reality, not only inducing romance, desire and lust, but also commanding individuals’ undivided attention despite more pressing concerns in the world of reality. Almost totally shot from the perspective of the TV screen itself, “Here’s looking at you kids” is a comic and ironic reflection on the way television and the media in general can hypnotise audiences and shape our everyday reality. Despite occasional cliches, “Here’s looking at you kids” has some good camerawork, an upbeat soundtrack and great production design.

results.title: Here's hockey
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Leslie McFarlane
results.brief_description: Hockey from the inside out, showing why it is an exciting spectator sport and Canada’s most popular national game. From the Pee-Wee division to the Bantam league, from the Canadian Amateur Hockey Association to the big-league professional stars, the film climbs the ladder, showing what it takes to make a hockey player - stick-handling ability, skating speed, science, strategy, expert coaches, and expensive equipment. And from east to west, the close identification of fans with players is evident in the excited cries, not of “They’ve won,” but of “We’ve won!”
